summary: The Pantheon is an ancient Roman temple in Rome, Italy, now used as a Catholic church. It was built around 126 AD by Emperor Hadrian, on the site of an earlier temple. The Pantheon is famous for its huge concrete dome, which is the world's largest unreinforced concrete dome. It has a circular shape with a large opening at the top called an oculus. The building is well-preserved and has been in continuous use, now attracting over six million visitors annually. Its unique design has inspired many architects over the centuries.
title: Pantheon, Rome
